TopicTitle: Things that NASA never said at a press conference.

Articles.Content:
"We built a boat out of old rocket parts"

"Based on measurements taken by the last moon mission, we believe it may be possible to build a jet engine"

Maybe if I put this he-BOOM!!!!!!!!!!!!

Oh-BOOM!!!!!!!!!

I-BBBOOOOOOOMMMMMMM!!!!!!!!!!!!!

"The launch is cancelled because we forgot to recover the vehicle staying on the launchpad since the previous attempt."

Edited January 30, 2018 by kerbiloid
"This rocket was meant to test very high retrothrust landing in water so it didn’t hurt the droneship, but amazingly it has survived. We will try to tow it back to shore."

On 01/02/2018 at 5:45 AM, cubinator said:

"This rocket was meant to test very high retrothrust landing in water so it didn’t hurt the droneship, but amazingly it has survived. We will try to tow it back to shore."

I see what you did there.

Let's try this one.

"I think I'll write a product review: 'Took product to the surface of Mars. It stopped working. 0\10'"
"At last we successfully took that Martian product. Also we took Martian sum, Martian ratio and Martian difference. So, MS Excel works fine on Mars."

Just now, kerbiloid said:

"At last we successfully took that Martian product. Also we took Martian sum, Martian ratio and Martian difference. So, MS Excel works fine on Mars."

"We're still not sure if it was the dot or cross product, though."
"During a test of our new satellite delivery system, we may have caused a total cessation of reality. We apologize for any non-existence this may have caused"

0/10 Stars

We took a KJI Mavik Krow to the moon and it wouldn't take off.

 

(DJI Mavic Pro)

“We suffered a tragedy today at the loss of the mission commander’s smartphone when someone depressurized the airlock before he could put it away.”

"We are not sure how the astronauts came back with aliens in the capsule, or how they found any life on the moon, but..."

Edited February 7, 2018 by TheMadKraken2297
Life autocorrected to love. Stupid piece of....

"You there, in the front!

"No, we did not anticipate the possibility of an accidental Jupiter descent"

"Yes, the rest of the mission was a success. It was all planned".

"No, we at NASA are not trying to break up spaceX, On account of the unfair competition corporate Monopoly rules. There is no other space company doing as well as SpaceX"

_____________________________________

"Excuse me... Uh.. NPR"

*Exasperated sigh* what.

"We ARE trying to send a probe into Pluto's gravity, no?"

"That would be accurate."

"So why did you sent it to Jupiter?"

*PR guy shoots reporter in head*

Edited February 7, 2018 by TheMadKraken2297
"The latest discoveries of gravitational waves will be groundbreaking in the music world"
"We just received a message from Starman. He is very angry."

Hey! 

Yeah?

Bill Bob, New York Times?

Yeah. Ask away.

So, why did you crash the probe into Jupiter? Wouldn't it be Cooley if you landed it to take pictures? Or made a Jupiter rover?

"We couldn't figure out the math, so we'll just wing this launch."

Here's a few old references:

"We will solve the ice build-up problem on our rocket suits with an ice inhibiting system from our contractor Aperture Science."

"Excuse me?" 

"Yeah?"

"Uh... Gene Kerman, FakeNewz.com. if we are trying to stop asteroids, then why did you slam the spacecraft into the asteroid? Why not just land a space shuttle on it and blow it up like in the movies?" 

"Security?"
...oops. Revert to launch!
